quest.name: The Three Collectors
journal: Inspector Hildibrand would have you accompany him to Coerthas.

Having received the blessings of Lady Durilda and Inspector Briardien, Inspector Hildibrand wishes to depart for Coerthas at once. Journey to the Observatorium and seek out any sellswords in Lady Durilda's employ.

Hildibrand quickly identifies one of Lady Durilda's sellswords, though the man is quick to deny the inspector's assertions. Inspector Briardien subsequently appears and explains the situation, much to the sergeant's chagrin. Recognizing you to be the most competent member of your party, the sergeant then asks that you assist one of his subordinates near the Observatorium's east gates.

The snows of Coerthas can play tricks on one's eyes, as you soon observe. While the sellsword watchman ventures outside to investigate something suspicious, Inspector Hildibrand nearly mistakes Gilgamesh for the thieving duelist. Electing to search a different area, Hildibrand and Nashu wander off. Follow them and see if their search yields anything of interest.

Ellie astutely observes that Inspector Hildibrand is unlikely to find the duelist inside the walls of the Observatorium. That being said, it would be dangerous to survey the wilderness unarmed─which is why Hildibrand is grateful when Nashu returns with a curious “spear” in her possession. The inspector immediately recognizes the weapon as the selfsame one which helped him journey to Dalamud five years ago. Precisely what inexplicable series of circumstances led to this reunion would doubtless make for an engrossing tale─alas, there are more pressing matters at hand. Survey the wilderness east of the Observatorium with the inspector and his assistant.

Fate can be ever so cruel. The budding friendship between Hildibrand and Gilgamesh is torn asunder when the warrior recognizes the inspector's spear as his own cherished weapon. What small hopes for reconciliation remain are further crushed when Ellie and Inspector Briardien arrive and identify Gilgamesh as the nefarious thieving duelist─a charge the warrior both confirms and denies. Distraught at being misunderstood by those whom he had come to trust, Gilgamesh flees to the south as Hildibrand gives chase─and so must you.

Outside the gates to Griffin Crossing, you find an incapacitated Inspector Hildibrand. Imploring you to stop his misguided former friend, you begin to search the bridge, and quickly find Gilgamesh waiting for you. The warrior proposes what he deems a duel─though his terms allow for you to summon allies. Triumph, and he will yield the spear. But should you fail, your weapons will be forfeit.

※Battle on the Big Bridge can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
Declaring that you have received a sufficient beating, Gilgamesh withdraws without claiming your weapon. Inform Inspector Briardien of all that has transpired.
Annoyed by yet resigned to Gilgamesh's escape, Inspector Briardien deems it safe to proceed with the Treaty-Blade's delivery. Proceed to Vesper Bay so that you may be present for the occasion.

Lady Durilda gleefully accepts the Treaty-Blade and takes her leave─only to appear a second time inquiring as to the whereabouts of her weapon. Inspector Briardien immediately deduces that the first Lady Durilda was in fact the thief who sent the challenge in disguise, and that Gilgamesh was a different thief who had no interest in the Treaty-Blade. The flying card which then embeds itself in the inspector's forehead appears to substantiate this theory, as the words writ upon it match the style of the previous challenge. “I shall come to claim the lapis maiden's virtue,” it reads, a bold challenge Inspector Briardien is glad to accept─until Inspector Hildibrand preempts his declaration, driving his rival into a frenzy. As the two men circle Lord Lolorito's statue in the square, Maria bursts into laughter, and her normally stern mother soon does the same. Despite failing to protect the Treaty-Blade, it would seem Inspector Hildibrand achieved an arguably more worthwhile measure of success.
objectives: Speak with the sellsword sergeant at the Observatorium.
Survey the wilderness east of the Observatorium.
Confront Gilgamesh in the Battle on the Big Bridge.
Speak with Durilda in Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Allow me to summarize our current plan of action! Our destination is the Observatorium, and our mission is to pose as goodly smallfolk, in accordance with Inspector Briardien's instructions.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Naturally, should the situation demand improvisation, we are to disregard those instructions. Any questions? No? Then let us sally forth at once!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: My redoubtable confederate! You are an experienced traveler, are you not? Why don't you lead the way to Coerthas?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: That damnable demon bird continues to elude me, but no longer! Soon I shall claim my revenge and weapon both...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hail to thee, fellow servant of justice! I take it you are one of the many tasked with transporting a counterfeit Treaty-Blade?

dialogue.name: HEISHI01318
dialogue.text: ...Clearly, you've mistaken me for someone else, sir.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: At ease, Sergeant. They're with us─more “smallfolk.”

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Keep an eye on them. Or else.

dialogue.name: HEISHI01318
dialogue.text:
B-But, sir, I─
...Bugger me.

dialogue.name: HEISHI01318
dialogue.text: Don't you bloody move until I get back!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: I say, is this land always so inhospitable? The biting winds, the endless snows...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Mayhap keeping active will help me to stay warm. Oh, and should I chance to find the thieving duelist, I will of course summon you─after administering the requisite beating, hah hah!

dialogue.name: HEISHI01318
dialogue.text: Good, you're still─ Hm? Wasn't there someone else with you a moment ago?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Ah, you speak of Greg! He ventured outside the gates mere moments before your arrival, full eager to catch the thief─as are we! Come, Nashu! We too must answer the call of duty!

dialogue.name: HEISHI01318
dialogue.text: ...You look like you might actually be useful. Why don't you have a word with my man near the east gates? We're undermanned over there.

dialogue.name: HEISHI01318
dialogue.text: Remember: we're looking for a brute in red who wields a halberd. You see the bastard, you come to me─no heroics. We take him together, understand?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Any halberd-wielding mummers shall answer to me!

dialogue.name: MIMAWARI01318
dialogue.text: Ye see that just now? No? Hmmm...

dialogue.name: MIMAWARI01318
dialogue.text: I don't think me eyes were playin' tricks on me, but there's only one way to be sure. You wait here.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Inspector! Over there, look!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: What is it, Nashu!? Pray tell me what you see!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Ah hah! I see you, demon bird! You will not escape me this time!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Why, hello there, my friends! Is aught amiss?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Oh, it's just Greg! For a moment, I thought you might have spotted our thief. Come, Nashu, we have lingered here overlong. We must egress posthaste!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hm. There is naught out of the ordinary here either...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: No luck, hm?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: We have scoured every ilm of this area to no avail. I can only conclude that, having learned that his opponent was to be the legendary inspector Hildibrand, the duelist renounced his criminal ways and retreated into hiding.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Or perhaps he is waiting patiently outside the walls for more wagons to leave? That being said, should you decide to venture into the wilderness, you had best arm yourself with more than your...wits.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I appreciate your concern, Miss Ellie, but a gentleman should abstain from violence unless absolutely necessary.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: I'll fight for you, Inspector! I even found a weapon to use!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: By the Twelve, is that the selfsame spear which propelled me to the red moon!? Wherever did you find it?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: It was buried in the snow!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Well, one cannot ignore the will of destiny! Return it to me, Nashu!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Though I will still endeavor to avoid fisticuffs, I will be duly armed should worse come to worst. Now then─we begin our search for the duelist to the east of the Observatorium!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Come now, how hard can it be to find a large man dressed in red in Coerthas?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Take your post, my good womanman, and entrust your safety to me! Inspector Hildibrand is ready for battle!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Cor, it's cold out here!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: ...Wherefore art thou, my nefarious nemesis?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: 'Twas not the selfsame creature, but one of many. Nevertheless, I know that my weapon is close by.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: You sense it, too, don't you?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Greg, I've been meaning to ask─why do you covet this weapon so?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: If you but beheld it, you would understand. In some ways it bore resemblance to a spear, but in other respects it was quite different.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: It was crowned with a magnificent axe blade...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: To which was welded a musket barrel...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: 'Twas one of the first weapons I added to my collection after arriving in these lands. Ah, how I yearn to reclaim it─the strongest of spears!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: That weapon of yours bears a striking...a striking resemblance to...to...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: The strongest of spears!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I-I claimed this weapon five years ago! Surely, you can't be serious!?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Grrr... Now you call me Shirley!? No matter─give it to me! GIVE IT TO ME!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: This spear and I have traveled together to the very heavens! I will not relinquish it again!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: This spear and I have bested many a man together! I will not relinquish it again!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Then we are at an impasse...

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: I-I can't believe I'm saying this, but...well done, Inspector!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, we've caught the weapon thief in the act!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: M-Miss Ellie, you are grossly misreading our dispute. Greg is a good, honest man, who I am certain has never stolen a weapon in his life!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Indeed, I have not! Every weapon I have claimed was by rights mine!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Each was a trophy for besting my opponent in single combat!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I believe that constitutes a confession. Seize him.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: A confession to what!? I have done naught wrong! Bah, you all are beyond reason!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Aaah! Yes, my plan to secure Greg's confession was utterly flawless, and his capture will be the coup de grâce!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Well, my plan is thus far flawless. Griffin Crossing is still impassable.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I know who you are, even if that imbecile doesn't, so let's not mince words. Only you have the skill to face the duelist in battle.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Even so, your strength alone will likely not suffice. I suggest you muster what allies you can.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Lest you find my advice unsporting, I remind you that our duty supersedes any misbegotten notions of honor you may possess.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Which way did he go, Forename!? Did you see?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...His name isn't really “Greg,” is it?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Nashu? Miss Ellie? ...Ah! My good womanman, it is a relief to hear your footfalls!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: As you have doubtless deduced, I was unable to prevent Greg from escaping through the doors. I must leave the rest to you!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Yes, it was I behind these doors the whole time! You took so long to arrive, I was getting worried you might have gotten lost!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Long did I wonder what your role in this play was. A silent guardian, content to watch events unfold with minimal interaction. At the last, I understand─we were fated to duel, you and I!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Best me, and you may have the spear. Fail, and your weapons are forfeit! Fair terms, do you not think? I will even extend them to your allies. Aye, I grant you leave to summon others. After all, it will avail you no advantage, heh heh...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: For Gilgamesh... It is embiggening time!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Do not worry about me, my friend! I shall─nnngh─extricate myself in due time!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: cut

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: cut

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: cut

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Alone yet still armed. Hmph.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: In any case, he seemed satisfied with the halberd. We will proceed with the delivery.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: If you wish to be present, I won't object. Meet me in Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: <groan> Why, Greg, why...?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Are you dead again, Inspector?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: How many swords did he drop while─ Wait, doesn't that one there look just like Eleazar's sword?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: But...even to my untrained eye, this is obviously a counterfeit blade. And so is this one, and this one! What in the world...?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Ahhh... 'Tis more magnificent than I imagined. 'Twill make a fine addition to my collection...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: And with that, our business is concluded. Cheers.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I genuinely mean that in your case, by the way.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: All's well that ends well, right, Inspector? Though it's a shame that Greg turned out to be the thief.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: There you are, Inspector Briardien! Why did you not wait for me at the docks?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Hm? Why are you all staring at me so? Oh, never mind that─where is my Treaty-Blade?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: But...didn't we just give you the Treaty-Blade?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Disguise yourself as the client and let the Treaty-Blade come to you...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Take advantage of an existing situation to distract us from the real crime. Brilliant.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The man in red never spoke of the Treaty-Blade─only the halberd.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Moreover, he always issued his challenges in person...

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Dear gods, isn't it obvious? What is it like in your funny little brains? It must be so boring.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: ...If the man in red did not send the challenge, then who did?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I believe this is addressed to me, condescending Inspector Briardien.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Piss off.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: “Four hundred years have I slept, one thousand faces do I wear. What is yours will be mine. I shall come to claim the lapis maiden's virtue.”

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: A many-faced phantom thief. Interesting.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: The design and the wording are the same as before. The thief who stole the Treaty–Blade sent this!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIENHILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: cut

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Very well! I─and I alone─Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, once more accept your challenge!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: You want a challenge, huh? Stand and face me, you buffoon!

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: Ahahahahahaha!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: How dare you all laugh at a time like this, after allowing my precious Treaty–Blade to be stolen!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: And you, Maria─

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: ...Well, I suppose it is a little funny, isn't it? The two of them dashing to and fro─a pair of gentleman mummers.

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text:
Ahaha... Ahahahaha!
You know, it's been far too long since we've seen a show. We should head into the city later─just you and me...

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Not bad, Hildy, not bad at all. You are indeed a Manderville man.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: <huff> <puff> Mark...mark my face, O phantom of many faces! For it is the...the face of the...of the... <huff> <puff>

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: The fiend dares lay claim to the fair maiden's virtue!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: As seeds of jealousy quicken within an inspector's soul!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Can true love bloom on this battlefield?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Will this Manderville man find his Manderville wife?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Hey, what's with the goggles those men were wearing? They look special!

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Maybe if I ask nicely, they'll give me a pair? I guess we'll find out next time!
